lines.text: Magnetic fields created by electric currents
Force with currents in same direction
Field applies force on moving charges

secText:
Enduring Understandings:
1. Electric currents create [OBJ:expsec_q771:magnetic fields] around them. The right-hand rule can be used to determine the direction of the magnetic field created by an electric current.
2. Two current-carrying wires placed close together exert a [OBJ:expsec_q772:force] on each other and the wires attract.
3. [OBJ:expsec_q769:Electric motors] generate currents that create magnetic fields.
